title: How to say 'Most people do not really want freedom, because freedom involves responsibility' in Greek - Quora

response.answer_text: Οι άνθρωποι δεν επιδιώκουν πράγματι την ελευθερία, καθότι αυτή προϋποθέτει ανάληψη ευθυνών. People do not really pursuit freedom, for it prerequisites assuming responsibilities. Δεν αρμόζει στους ελεύθερους η ανευθυνότητα. Freedom does not suit the irresponsible. You might want something related, not a per se translation: τό εύδαιμον τό ελεύθερον το δέ ελεύθερον το εύψυχον Happiness* lies in freedom and freedom lies in bravery**. *Eudeamonia results in hapiness, hence often translated as such, but it means when your mind is motivated by good daemons, where daemons for the ancients were entities outside our body and soul that triggered desires and motivated people towards good deeds and thoughts. The opposite is cacodaemonia. **Eupsychon leads people to show bravery in war, but literally it means having a good psyche, a good soul, a high spirit. Ergo, freedom prerequisites a good soul and good motives. Not all people need apply for very few actually do. So, eventually, freedom demands responsibly.

There are plenty of words you can use, but my suggestion is this. Οι περισσότεροι άνθρωποι δεν θέλουν πραγματικά την ελευθερία, γιατί η ελευθερία εμπεριέχει υπευθυνότητα. You can hear the pronunciation here: Μετάφραση Google.
